title: Sample Tender Template & Submission Checklist Complete Guide
description: A full, copy-ready tender template and a comprehensive submission checklist you can reuse for projects in Qatar.
content:
Overview

This article provides a complete, ready-to-use tender structure and an extensive checklist so procuring teams and suppliers can avoid common errors and speed up the tendering lifecycle. The template below is intentionally detailed copy the sections you need and adapt them to your project.

Full Tender Structure (Copy & Paste)

  1. Tender Title & Reference

    Example: Supply, Install and Commission – Office Furniture (Tender Ref: QTR-OF-2025-042)

  2. Introduction and Background

    Short context explaining why the procurement is required, e.g. new office fit-out, replacement of obsolete equipment, program objectives.

  3. Scope of Work (SoW)

    Clear deliverables, exclusions and technical specifications. Use sub-sections: Materials, Quantities, Performance Standards, Site Conditions, Deliverables and Acceptance Criteria.

    Example:

    • Provide itemized Bill of Quantities (BoQ) with model numbers
    • 3-year warranty on all supplied goods
    • Installation, testing, and commissioning included
  4. Eligibility & Mandatory Requirements

    List required certifications, trade license, insurance, and local presence requirements. E.g., Qatar Commercial Registration, sector-specific permits.

  5. Submission Instructions

    Specify file formats (PDF preferred), how to name files, whether hard copies are required, and the exact submission endpoint on the platform.

    Provide a sample file structure:

    • /Commercial/Price_Schedule.pdf
• /Technical/Methodology.pdf
• /Compliance/Certifications.pdf
• /CVs/Personnel_CVs.pdf
  6. Evaluation Criteria

    Weighting (example): Technical 50%; Commercial 35%; Delivery 10%; Local Content 5%. Define pass/fail gates (e.g., mandatory certificates).

  7. Clarification Period & Q&A

    State deadline for questions and date when answers will be published.

    Example: Q&A window opens on 2025-11-20 and closes on 2025-11-27; all answers published to all bidders by 2025-11-30.

  8. Contract Terms

    High-level payment terms, liquidated damages, retention, warranties and performance guarantees.

    Provide a sample payment schedule (e.g., 10% mobilization, 70% on delivery, 20% on final acceptance).

  9. Key Dates

    List important dates using absolute timestamps: Pre-bid meeting, Q&A close, submission close (date/time/timezone), evaluation period, expected award date.

  10. Annexes

    Attach templates: price schedule, bidder declaration, confidentiality agreement, sample contract, method statement templates.

Detailed Submission Checklist (for bidders)

Use this checklist internally before uploading your bid. Missing one of these often causes disqualification.

  • Signed Cover Letter on company letterhead
  • Completed Price Schedule (itemized)
  • Technical Proposal: methodology, workplan, quality management plan
  • Project Team: CVs, role descriptions, certificates
  • Company registration and trade license (copy)
  • Proof of relevant past performance: 2–3 project references with contact details
  • Financial documents: last 2 audited financial statements or bank reference
  • Compliance documents: tax clearances, sector-specific permits
  • Insurance certificates (if requested)
  • Signed declarations: conflict of interest, anti-bribery, local content statements
  • If applicable: JV or local partner agreement with roles and responsibilities

Example: How to Fill the Price Schedule

Provide unit price, quantity, subtotal, taxes (if applicable), and total. Add separate lines for optional items and assumptions. Always include a currency and the validity period of the offer (e.g., 90 days).

Item Unit Qty Unit Price Subtotal
Office Chair (Model ABC) each 100 QAR 250 QAR 25,000

Common Clauses You Should Consider

  • Force Majeure: define exclusion events and notice requirements.
  • Termination for Convenience: explain payments due on partial work.
  • Governing Law & Dispute Resolution: specify jurisdiction (e.g., Qatar courts or arbitration).
  • Liquidated Damages: daily penalty rate for late delivery.

Platform Tips for Procuring Teams

  • Use clear tags (e.g., construction, IT, qatar) to make the tender discoverable.
  • Publish Q&A publicly to maintain fairness.
  • Provide a short video or FAQ to explain complex technical points reduces clarifications and improves bid quality.
  • Keep evaluation rubrics attached so bidders know how scoring is done.

Final Notes

Maintain an audit trail for all tender actions (publish, question received, answer published, submission received). That protects your organization and increases trust in the procurement outcome.

Use this template as a starting point. Tailor technical specifications and contractual clauses to your procurement policy and legal advice.
